title: Football is finally tackling mental health problems - but more needs to be done
text:

Football tackling mental health problems is long overdue, and I'm delighted that it is finally being taken seriously.

But it's one thing being able to identify it, it's another doing something once it has been recognised, and we need to do an awful lot more to tackle it.

I think it's tougher to be a player these days, it was a lot easier years ago.

Social media makes it a lot worse because the stick that you listen to seems to be amplified a bit more, and it's from someone that is hiding, it can be vicious without accountability.

(Image: EFL)

The game is what it is but we have got to find ways to beat it on all fronts because surely the welfare of its players is most important - in fact it's paramount, in my opinion.

Football goes up and down. Years ago it would just be because a player is out of form, these days it could be a number of things that are wrong.

Football has a duty of care, and the game needs to take responsibility for that.

* Ian Holloway is a pundit on EFL on Quest throughout the season. Quest is the home of EFL highlights broadcasting every round of fixtures across the leagues. Also available on desktop and app via QuestOD

Daniel Stendel's sacking at Barnsley is very harsh

I think most sackings these days are harsh, I don't think anybody is getting long enough.

Daniel was fantastic last season in getting Barnsley promoted and he proved that anything is possible, it doesn't matter the size of your team it's the spirit of the players.

But I just don't know what the sacking is going to do to the players.

The way they played for him last year, they fought when no one had them promoted.

Not anyone in their wildest dreams would have got them promoted, apart from Daniel. It is very, very harsh, but that is football. That's the way it is.

(Image: Quest)

* The EFL's 'Goals Worth Talking about' aims to use the power of football to encourage conversation about our mental health.

To find out more about the EFL and Mind's campaign visit: https://www.efl.com/onyourside
